page.title: 05ENERGY AND NATURAL RESOUCES
page.content:
{ Gas}is the most popular fuel for domestic heating. Some people still burn {coal}and a few use{electricity. From a switching station (0835) Bradford is supplied by underground cable but other neighbouring towns by overhead line at l32,000 volts supported by large pylons. These and the wooden poles for domestic distribution detract from the attractiveness of the district.
{Coal}and{stone}have been mined here in the past. Once famous for "Denholme China" (a local brown pottery), it has been reported that {clay}is once again being mined on a small scale to a depth of 40 feet where the good quality 'white' clay is being exported to Russia.
